posts.post_content: Not strictly worse then [Armadillo Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armadillo Cloak), because the cloak's ability is a triggered ability and so you don't gain the life until after combat damage.

Posted By: ChttrBox88 (4/23/2013 6:43:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think the one thing that's majorly different between this and cloak is that no matter who controls the creature, you gain the life for cloak.  
  
It kind of creates a pseudo-"[Vow of](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vow of)" aura. If you are low on life, you can attach it onto an opponents creature and you'll still gain life. If they attack you, you'd gain the life they just dealt you. Mind you, if they deal lethal, you're up s\*\*t's creek.  
  
I guess the other thing is that this doesn't stack with lifelink. Cloak's ability is a triggered ability, while lifelink's a static ability.
posts.html:
I think the one thing that's majorly different between this and cloak is that no matter who controls the creature, you gain the life for cloak.

It kind of creates a pseudo-"Vow of" aura. If you are low on life, you can attach it onto an opponents creature and you'll still gain life. If they attack you, you'd gain the life they just dealt you. Mind you, if they deal lethal, you're up s**t's creek.

I guess the other thing is that this doesn't stack with lifelink. Cloak's ability is a triggered ability, while lifelink's a static ability.

posts.post_content:
Strictly worse than [Armadillo Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armadillo Cloak), due to how lifelink works compared to the cloak's ability. Still an amazing card. 5/5  
  
Edit: Guys, you're missing the point of what I'm saying. This would be functionally identical to the cloak but for two things.  
1) You can enchant your opponent's creatures with Armadillo Cloak as a sort of Pacifism.  
2) Multiple instances of lifelink don't stack. Armadillo Cloak's ability does.
